answers.answer: Hi,How is your daughter feeling?Pain, tingling and numbness are signs of neuropathy. Nerve involvement may be single (mono-neuropathy) or multiple (poly-neuropathy).Does she have color change at the site of pain on exposure to warm and cold sensations?This peripheral nerve pathology can be due to Diabetes, Prediabetes, Vitamin deficiency, and altered blood pressure status, any nutritional deficiency, and abnormal endocrine status, compression of nerve or impingement of nerve at time of exit from Vertebrae. You should be doing HbA1C, ESR, serum protein/immuno-electrophoresis, and vitamin B12, BUN, and creatinine levels.Keep me informed if you have any queries.Bye.

question: My 20 year old daughter woke up 2 days ago with her right foot feeling a bit numb, like it was asleep.  Now, 2 days later her leg feels heavy up to her knee,,, to flex her foot or curl her toes she has to concentrate really hard and her entire leg trembles.  She had a terrible headache for the past week that she says feels better now but she still complains of a light headache.  Also she complained of nausea the entire week... this really frightens me,,,   I took her to an internist who has ordered a nerve conduction test,,, but I am just worried about something bad that might be happening while I wait 2 weeks to have that test done.  She tried to walk on the treadmill but her foot is flopping heavily and she can't control her steps.  WHat do you think? SHe is in excellent condition otherwise,,, 5 foot 6 and 123 lbs....   ????  Thanks,,, WOrried Mom
title: Right foot numb to knee
